name: The Chase Hotel of Palm Springs

reviews.text: We stayed at the Chase for a couple nights. We didn’t want to leave! The pool was the perfect temperature, lush towels, and lots of sunshine. The guys at the front desk couldn’t have been more hospitable. People rave about the cookie at night---they’re OK. I recommend having a cocktail on your private balcony over looking the pool, with the mountains as the back drop. The breakfast is great. Fresh fruit, muffins, STRONG coffee.
reviews.title: couldnt be better
friendly service/great location
reviews.text: My partner and I just returned from a five night stay (mid-April) in one of the king/kitchen rooms. The room was large and very clean. Had a nice view of the mountains. The in-town location is perfect so we could walk to restaurants, shops, movies, etc.

The service by Jonathan, Craig and staff was excellent. It was friendly, helpful and all always had a smile. The morning breakfast by the pool was perfect: coffee, juice, numerous bread products, and a great variety of fruit (some fresh from their own trees). The pool was very clean and the property well-maintained. Free internet access and morning papers rounded out the welcoming attitude.
reviews.title: Great Choice
Stay at the Chase
reviews.text: We highly recommend this place for those who want good service, a great location, and plenty of relaxation. Remember to eat at LG's for steak and Pomme Frite for French/Belgian (mussels are great). Both are one minute by foot from the Chase.
If you want a comfortable place , quiet, but right in Palm Springs, check it out.
reviews.title: A great place to stay!
Seriously near Perfect.
reviews.text: My fiance and I spent two nights at The Chase over the Fourth of July holiday and couldn't of had a more positive experience. Our room was sharp and comfortable. The kitchenette had a smaller fridge which came in handy storing icy cold ones. The staff was friendly and helpful. The only complaint is that the air conditioning unit would loudly kick on and off in the middle on the night, waking me each time. I'm a light sleeper and if wasn't for my fiance's addiction to her very loud turbo fan (she travels with it!?) running all night, i wouldn't have slept well the second night. Plus, Palm Springs was boiling, I have never felt heat like that in my life. If it weren't for the noodle-filled Chase pool, I would have melted. Overall the Chase is fun and affordable and if you like staying places without a hint of pretension and extremely close to the action, this is the Joint for you.

They really cater to the details there like candles by the pool at night, warm chocolate chip cookies in the evening, and comfy and supersoft beds! What a delight! The staff is very friendly and courteous. The rooms were great and the view breathtaking with the mountains in the background. The pool was so serene. We did most of our swimming at night--just floating looking at the stars and black mountains. Only one block away from downtown yet so quaint and quiet. The breakfast was great. They really go out of their way to accomodate you. Highly recommended! If we ever go back to Palm Springs, I would definitely go back to Chase Hotel!
reviews.title: I see why it is rated #1 in Tripadvisor!

reviews.text: We booked this hotel having read the various reviews on trip advisor.
reviews.title: Great choice
Heaven-Can't wait to go back!
reviews.text: It largely lived up to the hype - amazing location right in the downtown area, conviniently close to Joshua Tree Park and with a gorgeous swimming pool with a fantastic mountain view.

reviews.title: A Quiet Place of Paradise
reviews.text: The rooms were really well designed, with elegant decor and really funky bathroom fixings.

The reviews are accuate about the rooms being clean and nicely decorated, personable staff, etc...but they were missing what I consider the MAIN reason for visiting Palm Springs. THE SUN. The pool has such potential, but it was really disappointing. The gardens are beautiful but there is lots of junk everywhere. New unwrapped lounge chairs, boxes of air conditioners etc... perhaps it was just during our stay and they will take care of it but everything sat unwrapped for 3 days. On top of that there wasn't any cleaning of the pool area. PETS are allowed so, and so is eating around the pool so in my opinion the area should be washed down nightly and the chairs put back in place for the next day. Instead the cement was dirty with the famous and yummy! chocolate cookies and dog poo, trash etc.. was everywhere.
reviews.title: Amazingly Hospitable but...!

reviews.text: It's such a contrast too, because the rooms are immaculate! But we didn't travel all the way to PS to stay in our room.
reviews.title: The Chase was Excellent!

reviews.text: People were allowed to dine at night by the pool, romantic yes, but they were also allowed glass. Glass and pools do NOT mix for so many obivous reasons.
reviews.title: Attractive, friendly staff and excellent location

reviews.text: All other reviews with the great comments about the rooms/staff were accurate, but it's more that just cracks on the pool deck that ruined the relaxing pool experience.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, wonderful stay!!
The Chase tries harder!
reviews.text: Don't even get me started on the inconsiderate beer drinking, hidiously loud radio crowd....Needless to say we were disappointed by a hotel we though had so much potential.

We stayed one night having booked it due to the wonderful reviews on trip advisor. When booking I mentioned to Rick that our USA touring holiday was to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary. Upon arrival we were shown to our delightful room which was complete with a complimentary bottle of champagne.
reviews.title: Champagne Welcome!

reviews.text: This small hotel provides such a welcome to all and we would recommend it without hesitation. The 'cookies' were delicious and added to the personal touch shown at 'The Chase'.
reviews.title: A gem in a desert paradise

reviews.text: Having found The Chase Hotel on TripAdvisor we can only say that it lived up to and surpassed our expectations.
reviews.title: my home away from home
The Chase Hotel is fabulous!
reviews.text: What can we say, we have found our own little piece of paradise. The staff are wonderful, the patio rooms (which we had) are large with the bonus of a great kitchen off the main room with fridge, cooker, etc.

reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel
reviews.text: The complimentary breakfast is more than enough to set you up for the day whether you plan exploring or just lazing around. The sheer pleasure of sitting by the pool set in pretty gardens with the backdrop of the surrounding mountains takes your breath away and returning at night to have your path lit by candles outside each room is thoughfulness beyond any we have ever experienced in our many travels.

reviews.title: Loved The Chase
reviews.text: We have just returned from a tour of the West Coast and The Chase was one of the hotels along the way. It is lovely with spacious rooms including a dining kitchen, large bedroom and bathroom. Ask for a room overlooking the pool with its own balcony and you won't be disappointed. The staff are friendly and helpful and the location great - you are only a few minutes walk from the centre of Palm Springs but happily tucked away in peace and tranquility. We would definitely stay there again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our experience at the Chase was wonderful. The staff were great – friendly and easy going. Check-in and out was very simple. We had a room with a kitchen – it was spacious, clean, and well decorated. Most of all, the room – all of the Chase in fact – felt like being home, a rare feeling in a hotel.
reviews.title: The Chase is Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The saline pool was fabulous – big, warm, a great deep end, lots of comfy lounges, and the center of attention on a hot Palm Springs summer day. Even the people staying there were friendly – no doubt caused, in part, by the welcoming atmosphere of the hotel. Many of them were return guests.
reviews.title: Best Place in town!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is included and was good. There was always a fruit bowl in the lobby, as well as tasty cookies. The patio has a barbecue, which we used as well. The hotel is in a fantastic location – a block from downtown Palm Springs, easy to find and park. If you have dogs, the hotel obviously is pet-friendly (especially since it was named after the owner’s dog, Chase). All in all, a great experience – we would not hesitate to recommend this hotel, and hope to return.
reviews.title: Great customer service!

reviews.text: Where do you start!
reviews.title: Deserving the Great Reputation...
Excellent hotel and service
reviews.text: My partner Suzanne and I spent a total of 5 nights at the Chase over two different stays in late July and early August. We were delighted with the experience: excellent location, very clean and spacious rooms and helpful staff. Summer for us is the low season for Palm Springs so the room prices were incredibly cheap, especially as breakfast and cookies were included. If you like the sound of 100 degrees, dry heat every day, this is the place to be!

reviews.title: This is the Best???
reviews.text: If the room and service were not enough, the helpful and laidback attitude of the staff just increased our enjoyment.

reviews.title: Simply the best
reviews.text: After reading all those fantastic reviews I have decided to spend two nights at the Chase Hotel. I was surprised to find out what people call the Best Hotel of Palm Springs! A motel-like building, a messy reception and a degenerated pool area ! Is this all that Palm Springs offers???

The room was nicely decorated in IKEA style, however for a hotel to be called the Best, there was missing a lot. There is a nice little kitchen, but without any pans, cutlery, plates and all those things that would be helpful to cook and eat. In the hotel directory was written, that you can ask for the kitchen equipment at the front desk, but when arriving late in the evening and staying only 2 nights at a hotel, I don’t want to have to organize everything I’m supposed to need. The bathroom was small but OK. The ants on the wall were harmless… but to share my bed with them wasn’t very peasant! The air-conditioning was not very effective (outside temperature 120°) and so loud that I had real difficulty to sleep.
reviews.title: ONCE AGAIN, THE CHASE IS GREAT!
Stay here!
reviews.text: The only positive remark I can make is the nice and helpful staff. The breakfast was simple but good. I felt like in a youth hostel.

We booked this hotel based on comments in Trip Advisor. This hotel was a good find. Yes it is older, but the renovations in the rooms are similar to those found in designer magazines. There just was a lot of ambience to the operation- fresh chocolate chip cookies at the reception area; lemon, fig and grapefruit trees with fruit for the picking; a warm non-chlorinated pool; comfortable beds; friendly staff; and a location, one block from the main street. We had to return to Palm Springs a second time in the trip and of course we booked at the Chase. Pay the extra small amount for a suite which is like a big one bedroom apartment. A second choice is 101? which is really a small suite disguised as a king bed room.
reviews.title: No complaints here
The Best
reviews.text: We have just returned from a two week stay in the States and I must say that our stay for two nights at The Chase was the best. If only there were some more motels/hotels like this: a very big room, very nicely and tastefully decorated, free of charge chocolate chip cookies, free internet access, a very good complimentary breakfast, a very nice setting, a big pool, what more could you want ... It was very "Wallpaperish". If ever we go to Palm Springs again, we would not hesitate a second to go back to this very nice motel.

My husband and I just returned from a long weekend at the Chase. We thought it was great, but if a cracked pool deck or an older style hotel bothers you, it's not the place for you. If you prefer expensive, high rise swanky resorts that require an elevator ride up to your room and then a long walk down a dark corridor, stay there. If you like a small, clean, cozy hotel with friendly, helpful staff and lots of charm and great mountain views, stay at the Chase. We really enjoyed breakfast outside while reading the paper and taking in the view of the pool and mountains. We also drank a bottle of wine by the pool and watched the sun go behind the mountains. The location is ideal for walking on Palm Canyon Drive, yet it is far enough off the main drag. We will definately stay again. Thanks for the homemade chocolate chip cookies and personal attention.
reviews.title: Loved the Chase
Just OK. Does not live up to hype.
reviews.text: I booked this hotel based on all the rave reviews on this site. The premises is clean and the pool area is very pleasant and serene. We booked a king room with a kitchen. The bathroom faucet was dripping continually, and there were ants on the sink countertop! The next day brought more ants, so housekeeping sprayed -- only a temporary fix. The room decor was fine, IMO. My wife didn't care for it. The proximity to shops and restaurants was superb! Parking was plentiful. The breakfast each morning was good. Great chocolate chip cookies! This is obviously an old place, so upgrades are needed, and the ants need to die! Overall, an OK experience. This hotel doesn't live up to all the hype.

We were given large rooms with kitchen and balcony on the 2nd floor overlooking the large pool, backdropped by the mountains. It really does look as good as the photos. The room was clean, tastefully decorated and everything was in full working order. The staff in reception were helpful and friendly and the complimentary breakfast was excellent. There is also free internet access in reception. We stayed in the off-peak season and probably wouldn't have looked at it due to the price at another time of year. However, having now stayed there, we would consider paying the extra in the future whatever the time of year.
reviews.title: Full marks from us

reviews.text: I felt like I was leaving good friends behind when I finally checked out of the Chase this past September. I don't think I could have dreamt a more accomodating, tastefully designed or comfortable atmosphere, especially for a woman travelling alone, which I was. ( and I own a NY design firm so I'm more than a little critical.)
reviews.title: The Chase, the Best

reviews.text: The pool is glorious, as is the abundance of plush, well sized pool towels that actually feel & fit nicely on the well appointed chaise lounges.
reviews.title: A Motel not a Hotel with some unwanted guests
Great location, spacious rooms
reviews.text: The morning breakfast much more than was promised.. with every variety of quality fresh fruit and a variety of melons, croissants, muffins,jellys, danish,cereal... you name it ,they had it.
I didn't experience any ant problem..
reviews.title: Choose the Chase!
Just what I was looking for but...
reviews.text: What I did experience was a convenient location and short walk to the best shops, book stores and restaurants, beautiful blooming Orange trees lining the pool area, families having fun and the look of contentment among the other guests as they sipped their morning coffee without disturbance or laughing by candlelight after an evening's swim.

description: The Chase Hotel offers a great location, value and style - and captures the true ambiance of Palm Springs like no other property. It's small, friendly and distinctive, nestled between the serene historic Tennis Club District and the vibrant energy and activities found in the downtown village and beautiful Palm Canyon Drive. This renovated gem offers more bang for the buck than just about anyone.
